sections.title: Dental fillings
sections.body:
Fillings are among the most common dental treatments. When they are done properly, they are precise repairs rather than routine work.

A filling restores a tooth that has been damaged by decay, wear, or fracture. The aim is to return strength and function while reducing the risk of further breakdown.

At St Mary’s House Dental Care, we take a conservative approach. The focus is on preserving healthy tooth structure and choosing restorations that are appropriate for the tooth over the long term, rather than short-term fixes.
bullets: Fillings are among the most common dental treatments.
When they are done properly, they are precise repairs rather than routine work.
A filling restores a tooth that has been damaged by decay, wear, or fracture.
The aim is to return strength and function while reducing the risk of further breakdown.

sections.eyebrow: Fillings are planned and placed with long-term stability in mind.
sections.title: Fillings are planned and placed with long-term stability in mind.
items: Fillings are planned and placed with long-term stability in mind.
Decisions are based on the condition of the tooth, how it functions, and how it is likely to behave over time, rather than a one-size-fits-all approach.
Fillings are planned and placed with long-term stability in mind.

sections.eyebrow: Several filling materials are available, and the most suitable choice depends on the tooth involved, its position in the mouth, and the forces it needs to withstand.
sections.title: Several filling materials are available, and the most suitable choice depends on the tooth involved, its position in the mouth, and the forces it needs to withstand.
sections.body:
Several filling materials are available, and the most suitable choice depends on the tooth involved, its position in the mouth, and the forces it needs to withstand.

We explain the advantages and limitations of each material, how visible a filling may be, how durable it is likely to be, and whether other options may be more appropriate in that situation.

sections.eyebrow: Placing a filling is usually a straightforward procedure, planned to remove damaged tissue while preserving as much healthy tooth structure as possible.

sections.eyebrow: After a filling, the tooth may feel slightly different for a short time as it settles.
sections.title: After a filling, the tooth may feel slightly different for a short time as it settles.

We’ll advise you on what to expect and when to get in touch if something doesn’t feel right.
After a filling, the tooth may feel slightly different for a short time as it settles.

sections.eyebrow: In some situations, a filling may not be the most reliable long-term option, particularly where a tooth has already lost a significant amount of strength.
sections.title: In some situations, a filling may not be the most reliable long-term option, particularly where a tooth has already lost a significant amount of strength.
sections.body:
In some situations, a filling may not be the most reliable long-term option, particularly where a tooth has already lost a significant amount of strength.

When that happens, we’ll discuss alternatives such as onlays or crowns, and explain the reasoning clearly so you can weigh the benefits and compromises of each approach.
bullets: In some situations, a filling may not be the most reliable long-term option, particularly where a tooth has already lost a significant amount of strength.
When that happens, we’ll discuss alternatives such as onlays or crowns, and explain the reasoning clearly so you can weigh the benefits and compromises of each approach.

sections.title: When a filling needs extra support
sections.body: If the tooth is heavily broken down or the nerve is affected, we guide you through the next restorative steps.

sections.eyebrow: Good daily cleaning and regular reviews help fillings last as well as possible.
sections.title: Good daily cleaning and regular reviews help fillings last as well as possible.
sections.body: Good daily cleaning and regular reviews help fillings last as well as possible. We’ll discuss any specific areas that need attention and how to look after the tooth going forward.

sections.title: Plan a calm filling appointment
sections.body: Contact us to discuss whether a filling is the right option for you.

clinical_focus: Material selection balancing isolation, load, and aesthetics
Bonded placement to strengthen margins and seal
typical_case_type: Replacement of fractured or leaking fillings under load
planning_considerations: Isolation quality and depth for bonding steps
Occlusal forces, parafunction, and protective splints
